# The Future of Efficient Air Travel
## The Next Generation of Regional VTOL Aircraft
[Connect with Odys Aviation](https://www.odysaviation.com/</connect>)
### We’re a sustainable aviation company building vertical take-off and landing aircraft to cut travel time in half on the world’s busiest routes.
Our aircraft redefines traditional air travel, enabling passengers to skip the hassle and delays of major airports while enjoying a private aviation experience at coach prices. Our advanced propulsion technology delivers 76% CO2 reduction compared to traditional aircraft.
The future of travel is here.
## Not another air-taxi.Our range covers 52% of domestic US air routes.
Our VTOL aircraft is more than an air taxi. While we can handle short-hops that connect airports with city centers, our aircraft flies up to 750 miles covering more than half of the busiest domestic routes in the US.
We are making travel corridors more efficient, reducing CO2 emissions by 76%. Odys Aviation is making getting from point A to point B effortless and sustainable.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/63ef8221e010d93450208422_unnamed%20\(1\).jpg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/63ef7d09114f2b6feb02aece_losangeles_coastline.jpg)
## We are a team of expert engineers from aerospace, electrification, and deep tech.
We've spent decades studying and creating the technologies of tomorrow. We've brought revolutionary transportation into mass production, designed specialized aeronautics, built electrified transportation systems, and advanced the science of fusion energy. Together, we’ve been learning, developing, building, testing, and preparing for this challenge our entire lives.
## The sustainable future of aviation.
Odys Aviation is building safe, sustainable aircraft to reduce travel time on the world's busiest corridors.
[I’m interested in working at Odys Aviation](https://www.odysaviation.com/</careers>)[Contact Us](https://www.odysaviation.com/</connect>)
## Frequently Asked Questions
### What is the range of the Odys Aviation aircraft?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/635bf38eec00ed2eefc50814_631606e93de44a06499857a8_arrow%201.svg)
Our aircraft can travel up to 750 miles using a hybrid-electric propulsion system. The aircraft uses the propulsion batteries to operate all electric for trips up to 200 miles, producing zero CO2 emissions. The aircraft’s turbine engine extends the range to 750 miles using sustainable aviation fuel.
### What is the speed of the aircraft?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/635bf38eec00ed2eefc50814_631606e93de44a06499857a8_arrow%201.svg)
The Odys aircraft will travel at speeds up to 345 miles per hour (555 kilometers per hour), similar to very light jets or the fastest turboprops of similar size and passenger capacity.
### When will it be available? Will it be certified?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/635bf38eec00ed2eefc50814_631606e93de44a06499857a8_arrow%201.svg)
Odys Aviation will start full-scale prototype test flights by late 2024. Type-certification will be late 2026 and begin commercial operations in 2027.
### What is the passenger capacity?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/635bf38eec00ed2eefc50814_631606e93de44a06499857a8_arrow%201.svg)
Our design can accommodate nine passengers and two pilots (certified for single pilot operation). With two pilot seats, the Odys Aviation VTOL can be piloted safely and seamlessly alongside traditional aircraft, a valuable factor for operators and regulators. The right seat also allows operators to build their bench of pilots.
### What is a blown-wing VTOL aircraft?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/61e8a49ab1718aa98bcc179a/635bf38eec00ed2eefc50814_631606e93de44a06499857a8_arrow%201.svg)
The Odys aircraft uses a blown-wing design to achieve vertical takeoff and landing. Instead of tilting wings or rotors, the aircraft uses a high-lift flap system. It provides impeccable control and vectors powerful upward thrust, all with mechanisms that are well known in the industry today. Our blown-wing design also looks great, with a silhouette that fits in nicely with a fleet of traditional aircraft.

**Odys Aviation: Redefining Vertical Air Travel**

Founded in 2019, Odys Aviation, previously known as Craft Aero, is pioneering a new wave of air travel with its innovative vertical takeoff and landing (VTOL) aircraft designed specifically for major airlines. The company is based in Los Angeles, California, and its mission is clear: cut travel time in half on some of the world's busiest routes by utilizing city helipads and local airports. This approach not only revolutionizes the travel experience but also significantly reduces carbon emissions.

### The Team Behind the Vision

Odys Aviation's team is a blend of electric propulsion and automotive manufacturing experts, boasting experience from industry giants like Virgin Hyperloop, GoogleX, Volvo, and Fisker Automotive. Their combined expertise has already garnered impressive traction, with two USAF Agility Prime contracts and pre-orders exceeding 1,000 aircraft. The team currently consists of 11 dedicated employees and is supported by Y Combinator's Batch S21, with Michael Seibel as their Group Partner.

### What Makes Odys Unique

Odys Aviation stands out not just as another air-taxi service. Their aircraft is capable of covering distances up to 750 miles and can operate at speeds approaching 345 miles per hour—on par with the fastest jets in its class. This capability means that their operations cover over 52% of domestic US air routes, enhancing connectivity while drastically reducing wait times typically associated with traditional flights.

One of the key features of Odys' aircraft is its advanced hybrid-electric propulsion system, which allows for fully electric operations for short journeys up to 200 miles, producing zero CO2 emissions. For longer trips, sustainable aviation fuel is used.

### A Sustainable Future

Odys Aviation is committed to sustainability, boasting a staggering 76% reduction in CO2 emissions compared to traditional aircraft. The aircraft employs a blown-wing design for seamless vertical takeoff and landing, offering better control and efficiency without the visual disruption caused by tilting wings or rotors.

The company is currently gearing up for full-scale prototype test flights by late 2024, aiming for type-certification by late 2026 and commercial operations to commence in 2027. It's a thrilling time for aviation enthusiasts and those advocating for greener alternatives.

### Conclusion

Odys Aviation is at the forefront of a paradigm shift in air travel, looked at not just through the lens of convenience but also sustainability. Their vision of a world where passengers can travel effortlessly and more sustainably is drawing closer to reality. If you’re intrigued by this innovator in aviation, you can check out more on their [website](https://www.odysaviation.com/) and follow their journey. 

The future truly is airborne.
